page.title: 10Buildings
page.content: Some farmhouses have wattle and daub (Ducksworth, West End, Firs Farm) Stone (with thatch) was used for several buildings of Special Architectural or Historic Interest in the High St -Fir Tree Cottage, "the Whit Horse", Joel's Cottage(with 2 thatched squirels and 2 pheasants on the ridge).The limestone and tile school and schoolhouse(1860) were built by the Bromham Estate as a church school.Some 30 cottages in Stagsden parish were built by the Crown, all are in the same style, brick with slate roof such as Firs Farm Cottages.Many farm workers cottages are now in private ownership. 2 or 3 former cottages are now 1 dwelling.Modern development includes some council houses along the High St.built in 1930's, Oakcroft built by the council in 1972, Bunyan Lodge 1969
